sen.j: 藩主島津斉彬の藩政改革のもと、大坂藩邸留守居役など、諸藩の志士との交流を重ね、若手改革派の一人として活躍する。
sen.e: In the process of reformation of domain duties by Nariakira SHIMAZU, the lord of the domain, Tomozane, forging close ties with royalists in other domains as a rusuiyaku in the residence of the lord in Osaka, played an active role as a younger reformist.

After Nariakira's death he attempted to leave the domain with his forty comrades including Toshimichi OKUBO, but as Tadayoshi SHIMAZU, lord of the domain, dissuaded him from leaving, he then assumed the post of Ometsuke-yaku (inspector general).

sen.j: 戊辰戦争の緒戦である鳥羽伏見の戦いでは、自ら兵を率いて幕府軍を撃退するなど多大な功績をあげ、1869年、賞典禄1000石を授けられた。

sen.e: When SAIGO was given Ikai (Court rank) for his merits to the Restoration of Imperial Rule, Tomozane, having forgot his imina (one's real personal name, but tabooed out of respect while he is alive), reported his imina as "Takamori", which was Kichibe, SAIGO's father's imina.

When SAIGO was given a court rank for his achievements in the Restoration of Imperial Rule, Tomozane, having forgot SAIGO's imina (real personal name, but tabooed out of respect while he was alive), erroneously registered his imina as "Takamori" which was SAIGO's father Kichibei's imina.

sen.e: Subsequently, he offered his residence to SAKAMOTO on his honeymoon in Satsuma and was presented a short sword named "Raikunimitsu " as a token of SAKAMOTO's gratitude.
Subsequently, Tomozane offered his residence to SAKAMOTO on his honeymoon in Satsuma, and was in return presented a short sword named "Raikunimitsu" as a token of gratitude.

sen.j: 外遊中、パリで会った留学生の清水誠にマッチの製造を勧めている。
sen.e: During his official travel in Paris he recommended manufacturing of matches to Makoto SHIMIZU, who was studying there.
